channel.title: Installing Linux w/o disturbing windows in any way or form?
channel.description:
Sup niggers.
I really really really want to try out linux, so let me be the first to ask, is there any way to install/use linux without disrupting windows in any way or form? Not a dual boot either. I have heard of using a Virtual PC but don't know if it will work.
Ty for all help.

item.title: Installing Linux w/o disturbing windows in any way or form?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

ninja nub:

Why do people ask if you can dual boot? Of course. You can boot windows into linux and basilik II (Old school Mac)

How exactly do you boot windows into linux/mac os?

Read full topic

item.source: Installing Linux w/o disturbing windows in any way or form?

item.title: Installing Linux w/o disturbing windows in any way or form?
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“1337h4x, post:14, topic:153207”][quote author=ThAt0n36Uy link=topic=209505.msg1836009#msg1836009 date=1192958109]
It’s impossible for installing another distribution to not affect Windows, because you’re changing the Partition Size for one. As well as the amount of RAM you have. Though, you can use a Virtual Machine, which will take up space on your drive, but it will also run through Windows, and won’t affect the way it operates, except by slowing your computer down a LOT. I mean, just Dual Booting won’t affect Windows in any really dramatic way.
[/quote]So it could work on a virtual machine? I’m not gonna work or anything on linux, I just want to try it out, so I don’t care abou speed, etc.[/quote]

1337h4x:

http://www.lifehack.org/articles/technology/beginners-guide-run-linux-like-any-other-program-in-windows.html

Read full topic
item.source: Installing Linux w/o disturbing windows in any way or form?

item.title: Installing Linux w/o disturbing windows in any way or form?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“1337h4x, post:14, topic:153207”][quote author=ThAt0n36Uy link=topic=209505.msg1836009#msg1836009 date=1192958109]
It’s impossible for installing another distribution to not affect Windows, because you’re changing the Partition Size for one. As well as the amount of RAM you have. Though, you can use a Virtual Machine, which will take up space on your drive, but it will also run through Windows, and won’t affect the way it operates, except by slowing your computer down a LOT. I mean, just Dual Booting won’t affect Windows in any really dramatic way.
[/quote]So it could work on a virtual machine? I’m not gonna work or anything on linux, I just want to try it out, so I don’t care abou speed, etc.[/quote]

If you want to try it out, download any distro that comes as a live cd, put the cd in your disk drive restart computer press what is needed to get to your boot menu click on cd drive and let it boot up.
Nothing is changed as its loading off the cd.

Read full topic
item.source: Installing Linux w/o disturbing windows in any way or form?

item.title: Installing Linux w/o disturbing windows in any way or form?
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:5, topic:153207”]It’s impossible for installing another distribution to not affect Windows, because you’re changing the Partition Size for one. As well as the amount of RAM you have. Though, you can use a Virtual Machine, which will take up space on your drive, but it will also run through Windows, and won’t affect the way it operates, except by slowing your computer down a LOT. I mean, just Dual Booting won’t affect Windows in any really dramatic way.[/quote]So it could work on a virtual machine? I’m not gonna work or anything on linux, I just want to try it out, so I don’t care abou speed, etc.

Read full topic
item.source: Installing Linux w/o disturbing windows in any way or form?

item.title: Installing Linux w/o disturbing windows in any way or form?
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

ThAt0n36Uy:

Maybe not, but I remember installing Ubuntu and Windows Xp, and I booted Windows and 400mb of my ram was missing.

Then you did something wrong…You only need to allocate HDD space, not ram. The state of ram isn’t even saved between boots, so I see no feasible reason for an OS to need a certain amount of RAM allocated to it 100% of the time.

Read full topic
item.source: Installing Linux w/o disturbing windows in any way or form?

item.title: Installing Linux w/o disturbing windows in any way or form?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:10, topic:153207”][quote author=ThAt0n36Uy link=topic=209505.msg1836063#msg1836063 date=1192960560]
I’m pretty sure you have to allocate ram to each Operating system.
[/quote]It has nothing to do with ram. I dualed kubuntu myself, after a while I didn’t want it but I didn’t know how to uninstall it so I accidentaly deleted my windows. Watch out 1337h4x, don’t do the same mistake as I did.[/quote]

Maybe not, but I remember installing Ubuntu and Windows Xp, and I booted Windows and 400mb of my ram was missing.

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Linux w/o disturbing windows in any way or form?
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

Wroooong, ThAt0n36Uy. Wubi/Lubi doesn’t partition at all.

item.source: Installing Linux w/o disturbing windows in any way or form?

item.title: Installing Linux w/o disturbing windows in any way or form?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

It’s impossible for installing another distribution to not affect Windows, because you’re changing the Partition Size for one. As well as the amount of RAM you have. Though, you can use a Virtual Machine, which will take up space on your drive, but it will also run through Windows, and won’t affect the way it operates, except by slowing your computer down a LOT. I mean, just Dual Booting won’t affect Windows in any really dramatic way.

Read full topic
item.source: Installing Linux w/o disturbing windows in any way or form?

item.title: Installing Linux w/o disturbing windows in any way or form?
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

Do a quick google of Wubi. It’s exactly what you want, except it is dual-boot. It doesn’t touch Windows in any way though, and I’m afraid it’s the closest you’ll get.
Also, @runescape3, if you can’t type anything useful, get off the computer.

Read full topic
